_meta.note: Consolidated from 'Customer Interview Playbook' and 'Customer Interview Playbook 2'. Provides complete methodology for conducting customer discovery interviews using Mom Test principles.

consolidation_notes.merge_rationale: Original two sheets contained complementary playbook content split across tabs. Combined into single comprehensive playbook.

who_to_interview: Current electrolyte supplement users (LMNT, Liquid IV, Drip Drop, etc.)
People in target ICP segments (keto/carnivore, biohackers, athletes, fasters)
People who have STOPPED using electrolyte supplements (churned users)
People who have never tried electrolyte supplements but match ICP demographics
interview_basics.how_many: 5-20 interviews before launch. You'll know you have enough when you stop hearing new information (saturation).
interview_basics.how_long: 20-30 minutes each. Respect their time. Better to end early than run over.
where_to_find_them: Facebook groups (keto groups, fasting groups, CrossFit groups)
Personal network (friends, family, colleagues who match ICP)
Competitor review sections (LMNT, Liquid IV Amazon reviews)
interview_basics.compensation: Not required for pre-launch. Post-launch: free product or 50% discount code as thank you.

sections.goal: Build rapport. Make them comfortable. Explain the purpose (learning, not selling).
key_actions: Thank them for their time
Explain: 'I'm researching how people manage hydration and energy. There are no right or wrong answers.'
Confirm recording permission if applicable
Do NOT mention your product yet

sections.goal: Understand their context, lifestyle, and health routines.
key_actions: Ask about their daily routine and health practices
Understand their diet and exercise habits
Learn what supplements they currently take and why
Listen for unprompted mentions of energy, hydration, or fatigue

sections.goal: Deeply understand their pain points around hydration, energy, and mineral intake. This is the most important section.
key_actions: Ask about specific moments when they feel worst (energy crashes, cramps, brain fog)
Explore what they've tried to solve these problems
Understand what worked and what didn't, and why
Ask about the emotional impact of these problems
Follow up on every interesting thread - don't stick to the script robotically

sections.goal: Understand their relationship with current solutions. Only introduce your concept in the last few minutes if relevant.
key_actions: Ask what they're currently using and why they chose it
Explore what they wish was different about their current solution
If appropriate, briefly describe the marine plasma concept and gauge reaction
Ask what would make them switch from their current product
Do NOT pitch. Observe their genuine reaction.

sections.goal: Close gracefully. Get permission for follow-up. Ask the magic question.
key_actions: Ask: 'Is there anything I should have asked but didn't?'
Ask: 'Who else should I talk to about this?'
Thank them sincerely
Ask permission to follow up when product launches

opening: Tell me about your typical day - what does your health routine look like?
What supplements or health products do you currently use, if any?
How did you first get interested in [keto / fasting / fitness / biohacking]?
problem_discovery: Walk me through the last time you felt really low energy or dehydrated. What happened?
What's the most frustrating thing about managing your hydration or electrolytes?
How often does this problem actually affect your day? Give me a recent example.
What have you tried to solve this? What worked and what didn't?
purchase_journey: How did you find out about [their current electrolyte product]?
What made you choose that one over others?
What would make you switch to something else?
How much do you spend on electrolytes/hydration per month?
product_experience: What do you love about what you're using now?
What do you wish was different?
If you could design the perfect electrolyte product, what would it be?
What would make you tell a friend about an electrolyte product?
social: Where do you go to learn about new health products?
Who do you trust for health recommendations?
Have you ever recommended an electrolyte product to someone? What did you say?
closing: Is there anything I should have asked you that I didn't?
Who else do you know that I should talk to about this?
Can I follow up with you when we have something to share?
key_question_categories.magic_question: If you could wave a magic wand and change one thing about how you manage your hydration and energy, what would it be?

after_each_interview: Key quote (the most surprising or revealing thing they said)
Primary pain point (what's actually bothering them most)
Willingness to pay for a better solution
ICP segment alignment (which archetype do they match?)
after_all_interviews: Most common current solution and its weaknesses
Best marketing quotes (with permission to use)

dos: DO listen more than you talk (80/20 rule)
DO ask follow-up questions: 'Tell me more about that' and 'Why?'
DO ask about specific past behavior, not hypothetical future behavior
DO take notes on emotions, not just facts
DO shut up after asking a question - let silence do the work
DO record (with permission) so you can focus on listening
DO ask about what they've actually done, not what they plan to do
donts: DON'T pitch your product (this is research, not sales)
DON'T ask leading questions ('Don't you think marine plasma is better?')
DON'T ask 'Would you buy this?' (everyone says yes, it means nothing)
DON'T interrupt or finish their sentences
DON'T defend your idea if they criticize it - learn from the criticism
DON'T take compliments as validation (compliments are worthless in interviews)
DON'T ask about the future ('Would you use...') - ask about the past ('Have you ever...')
